item.title: 1.Install debian (bookworm)
item.description: Make Debian bootable USB using linux Download Debian installer Connect the USB flash drive and identify its device path. In this example, it’s /dev/sda (determine the correct device by its size) ❯ lsblk NAME MAJ:MIN RM SIZE RO TYPE MOUNTPOINTS sda 8:0 1 7.2G 0 disk ├─sda1 8:1 1 7.2G 0 part /media/kurotych/CCCOMA_X64FRE_EN-GB_DV9 └─sda2 8:2 1 1M 0 part /media/kurotych/UEFI_NTFS nvme1n1 259:0 0 931.5G 0 disk ├─nvme1n1p1 259:2 0 16M 0 part ├─nvme1n1p2 259:3 0 513M 0 part /boot/efi └─nvme1n1p3 259:4 0 931G 0 part / nvme0n1 259:1 0 931.

item.title: 2. Add user to sudoers
item.description: su --login apt install sudo adduser <YOUR_USER_NAME> sudo Do a full logout and login again (Execute exit command twice. first - you exit from su, second you exit from your user) Selfcheck Run sudo apt update Links https://wiki.debian.org/sudo

item.title: 3. Install git & curl
item.description: sudo apt install git curl Links https://github.com/curl/curl

item.title: 4. Install text editor (Neovim)
item.description: Check the latest stable neovim release (optional) curl -sSL kurotych.com/debisway/scripts/get_latest_neovim_stable_version.sh | sh Script source code curl -s https://api.github.com/repos/neovim/neovim/releases/latest | grep "tag_name" | awk '{print $2}' | tr -d '",' Make a temporary directory. mkdir temp && cd temp Download Neovim (replace v0.10.0 with the desired version): curl -LO https://github.com/neovim/neovim/releases/download/v0.10.0/nvim-linux64.tar.gz Unpack the archive and navigate to the extracted directory: tar -xzf nvim-linux64.tar.gz cd nvim-linux64 Move the extracted files to /usr/local: sudo cp -r .

item.title: 5. Install sway
item.description: I recommend install Sway from the apt repository. I’ve tried installing it from source, but after 1-2 hours, I left this idea. sudo apt install sway xwayland > sway TIP Possible shortcodes to open terminal: alt + enter | command + enter | win + enter

item.title: 6. Install browser
item.description: sudo apt install firefox-esr Run in terminal > firefox
